source.4deca355:
import datetime
def correct_date(x,y):
    if(len(y[x.str.contains(".")==True])>0):
        x=x.str.replace(".","/")
    if(len(y[x.str.contains("\\xc2\\xa0")==True])>0):
        x=x.str.replace("\\xc2\\xa0","")
    if(len(y[x.str.contains("//")==True])>0):
        x=x.str.replace("//","/")
    if(len(y[x.str.contains("-")==True])>0):
        x=x.str.replace("-","/")
    if(len(y[x.str.contains(r"\\\\xc2\\\\xa0")==True])>0):
        x=x.str.replace(r"\\\\xc2\\\\xa0","")
    return x

df['Date']=correct_date(df['Date'],df)
df.loc[192,"Date"]="05/07/2018"
df.loc[2571,"Date"]="01/07/2015"
df.loc[2606,"Date"]="10/7/2015"

import plotly.graph_objects as go

fig = go.Figure(
    data=[go.Scatter(y=amount, line=dict(color="crimson"))],
    layout=dict(title=dict(text="Amount Funded V/s Year")),
    
)

fig.update_layout(
    title="Amount Funded V/s Year",
    xaxis_title="Year",
    yaxis_title="Amount(in USD)",
    xaxis = dict(
        tickmode = 'array',
        tickvals = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5],
        ticktext = year_val)
    
)

fig.show()

fig8 = go.Figure(go.Bar(
    x = df.groupby('Startup Name')['Amount(in USD)'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False)[:3].values,
    y = df.groupby('Startup Name')['Amount(in USD)'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False)[:3].index,
    orientation='h'
))

fig8.update_layout(
    title="Startups V/s Amount Funded",
    yaxis_title="Startups",
    xaxis_title="Amount Funded"
    
)
fig8.show()

source.1baf4be7: # 3. No. of Startups funded with respect to the cities
source.0da24689:
• The maximum amount in funding 10.42B USD was in 2017 followed by 9.70B USD in 2019 with the lease in 2016 i.e. 3.82B USD
  • The minimum amount in funding is in 2020 due to date being limited January. However, one thing is quite interesting, even though maxiumum number of startups got funded in 2016, but the amount is the least among all years(not considering 2020).
source.3dddd1eb:
Findings-
  • Maximum No. of startups were funded in 2016 followed by 2015.
  • 2020 saw minimum because the data is limited to Jan 2020
source.365486fd: # 10. Top 3 Startups with respect to the fund allocation
source.c6c57ef9: # 5.Percentage share of Industry vertical of startups
source.760abfa6: **The Consumer Internet dominates the industry vertical with approximately 50% followed by Technology(~ 25%), E-Commerce(~ 16%), Healthcare(~ 3.7%), Finance(~ 3.3%), Logistics(~ 1.7%), Education(~ 1.3%)**
source.ac217a95: # 6. Amount Funded with respect to the Investment Type
source.a566da33: **Seed Funding was the major contributor in the startup ecosystem with respect to the number of startups funded, funding approximately 1428 startups.**
source.34b2a585:
**Maximum number of startups were founded in Bengaluru(854) followed by Mumbai(574) ,Delhi(463) ,Gurugram(341) and Pune(112).
The reasons for Bengalurur being the startup capital of India can be attributed to it being the technical hub with almost every MNC being located there.**
source.e96f3748:
**Findings-
Private equity contributed the most(~27 B USD) in the funding of startups followed by Series B, D and C.**
source.182c248a:

source.a3146445:
**Undisclosed investors funded the most startups with respect to the other investors.
